chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: No contact with H.M unless approved by DOC agent. No intentional contact with Officer D.A.J.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

9:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel A. Martinez in court, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders in court for Daniel A. Martinez. Felony hold open agreement filed. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 3. Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 and 3. Count 4 is dismissed and read in. Count #2 HELD OPEN - If defendant successfully completes all conditions of hold open agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss count 2 only. On counts 1 and 3, Court orders sentence withheld 2 years probation. Defendant to report to probation today. As a condition of probation, No contact with HM unless authorized by agent. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit zero days. Court orders bond modified to $1000 signature bond with conditions: No contact with H.M unless approved by DOC agent. No intentional contact with Officer D.A.J.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:19 PM Defendant Daniel A. Martinez in court by video in custody with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty on all counts. Court denies defense motion to modify bond. Matter to be set.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
